data.name: Using inclusive language
data.description: Choosing to communicate in a way that includes all people and is free from bias, prejudice, and discrimination.

recommendations.markdown: Anyone working on a team of diverse individuals needs to keep in mind that some kinds of language might exclude some of those team members.

Do you intentionally use language that doesn't exclude specific groups? Someone who is an expert at this skill is in the habit of speaking about others using purposefully chosen words based on their understanding of how others perceive those words.
Queen's University has [inclusive language guidelines](https://www.queensu.ca/styleguide/inclusivelanguage) in their style guide.

This skill is used anytime you refer to a person or group in writing or speech. This occurs in everything from documentation talking about the users of your systems to conversations about members of your company.

The next time you write something, regardless of the diversity of the present audience, anticipate that the audience of anything you write will change. Keep in mind that new readers of your written words will be people and members of groups that you may not have considered when originally writing them.
